children.text: Let's get started with a project where we will get familiar with Data data. There are many possible ways to use Data data, but here we will use these technologies:
Vite as the frontend tool, using React
Express as the API server, using REST for the communication
You need to have Node installed on your computer.
You should now have a working React / Vite project. Let's also add an Express server to the mix:
, we can start the server with:
To use the server from the frontend, we change
And finally setting up Vite to proxy the calls to the server in
The quickest way to get started with a database is to use SQLite. Let's go with
as our library to talk to SQLite. In order to use it with Data data, we use the library
. And since we want to log to the console, we use
Now we can initialize the database in
we get a log like this the first time:
info: Starting migration of database schema to version=1...
info: Migrated database schema to version=1
info: Starting migration of database schema to version=2...
info: Migrated database schema to version=2
info: Starting migration of database schema to version=3...
info: Migrated database schema to version=3
info: Starting migration of database schema to version=4...
info: Migrated database schema to version=4
info: Starting migration of database schema to version=5...
info: Migrated database schema to version=5
info: Starting migration of database schema to version=6...
info: Migrated database schema to version=6
we have the actual database with the latest database schema, configured with Write-Ahead Logging (WAL) (which means you might see temporary files
as well) for write performance and FTS5 as the full-text search module.
In order to interact with the database we need a server.
The main thing we need to provide to the server is the database adapter. We also need to provide an authorization adapter, for now we'll go with a standard
. To prepare for talking to the server we also initialize an admin and a published client for an anonymous user (both
The server takes ownership of the database adapter, and when we're done with the server we need to call
so it can disconnect from the database. We also want to disconnect all connections to the HTTP server.
Now when we start the server (
) and shut it down, we get a log like this:
info: No schema set, defaulting to empty
In order to be able to create content we first need to create a schema. We can do it in

after creating the server. Using the admin client we create a schema with one entity type, with one string field. Finally, we generate TypeScript types for the resulting schema to get more feedback from the compiler when interacting with the API.
types, from the generated TypeScript types. This helps the compiler checking we use the right values for things like entity types and the types of entity fields.
Before creating some entities, we use the API call
to check how many messages exist already.
When creating the entity we provide the entity type, auth key, name and
field. We also specify that we want to publish the entity as an atomic operation when creating the entity.
